Summary: Saw two hot dog like objects in the sky. Bun part highly reflective center was black.
trends: There have been 66 other sightings in Jacksonville
There were no other sightings in Jacksonville on or around December 18th 2008
divs: sighting detailslocation unf campus 1 unf drive jacksonville florida we had just punched out of work and left the building. i looked up and saw a shiny chrome like object moving kind of slow and steady, like it wasn't in a hurry. i asked my coworkers what they thought it was. they said it was an airplane. i looked harder at it. it had no wings left, no vapor trail. next i listened, there wasn't any sound. i looked for rotors like a helicopter, it had none. the shape was perfect. no lumps, bumps or protrusions . the only way i can discribe it: it looked like a big floating hot dog. the top and bottom (the bun) was highly reflective like chrome. the center (hot dog) was black in color. it was moving southward. as i was observing this i caught sight of a second one traveling northward. i hadn't seen it before. it was moving at the same speed and altitude. neither one seemed in a hurry. it wasn't a jetliner (no wings) it wasn't a helicopter although it was about the size of a chinook. (color was chrome like and the shape was too smooth. it wasn't a blimp(too long and not fat like a blimp) i have lived in jacksonville around 17 years. with 3 military bases here you see all kinds of aircraft. throw in the blimps and it is a pretty good number of aircraft. i watched the southern one till it disappeared behind a building. the whole thing lasted about 5 minutes. my coworkers went on to their cars while i stood there watching. the incident has bugged me for several days. i looked on your websight to see if anyone else reported it. nothing there. but today i started going back in your list of past sightings. surprisingly i found an almost identical event on 2\3\07 almost in the very same area where i work. this encouraged me to write you and give you the details of my sighting. i am not saying i saw a "flying saucer", for the life of me i cannot figure out what i did see.
